thread.title: H.S. football: Games to watch this week
thread.title_full: H.S. football: Games to watch this week

title: H.S. football: Games to watch this week
text:
TODAY 
No. 15 Garfield (5-1)at No. 11 Rutherford (6-0), 7 
Story line: Garfield had a huge bounce-back win last week over Waldwick/Midland Park, and it gets to play for sole possession of first place in the NJIC Colonial. The Bulldogs have one of North Jersey’s most productive offenses, averaging 42 points per game. 
The pick: Rutherford 
No. 4 Don Bosco (4-2)at Bishop Gorman (Nev.) (8-0), 10 
The story: The last and greatest out-of-state challenge for the Ironmen. The Gaels are ranked No. 1 in the nation and have outscored the opposition, 400-82. Bosco’s two losses have been by a combined 13 points. 
The pick: Bishop Gorman 
No. 3 Paramus Catholic (3-3)at IMG Academy (6-0), 7 
Story line: This is the Paladins’ most daunting assignment. A defense led by senior DL Rashan Gary, junior LB Drew Singleton and junior DL Corey Bolds will encounter an offense guided by Ole’ Miss-bound senior QB Shea Patterson, Rivals.com’s No. 1 overall player in the national Class of 2016. IMG is ranked No. 7 in USA Today’s Super 25 national poll. 
The pick: IMG Academy 
No. 9 Hackensack (3-2) at No. 10 Ridgewood (5-1), 7 
Story line: With three games remaining before the postseason cutoff, the Comets hit the road in need of power points in North 1, Group 5. The Maroons have won five straight and sit atop the North 1, Group 5 power-point standings (91). Hackensack’s defense, led by senior LB Jaysen Thompson (51 tackles, 16 for losses), must limit a Ridgewood offense that has averaged 36.8 points since losing its opener. 
The pick: Hackensack 
No. 14 Lakeland (4-2)at No. 7 Wayne Valley (6-0), 7 
Story line: The Lancers, whose losses have come by a combined 11 points, are fighting for a playoff berth in a loaded North 1, Group 2. They’ll have to pull off an upset on the road against an unbeaten Group 4 team. Wayne Valley, which hopes to have senior QB Nick Goodwin (foot) back behind center, is pursuing a home playoff game in North 1, Group 4. 
The pick: Wayne Valley 
Cresskill (4-2) at No. 18 Hasbrouck Heights (5-1), 7 
Story line: Cresskill thrust itself back into the North 1, Group 1 race with last week’s win over Park Ridge, and can shuffle things even more against its rival. The Aviators have won four straight and are playing outstanding defense. 
The pick: Hasbrouck Heights
